plants.name: Rosa 'Knock Out'
plants.description: A robust and disease-resistant rose variety widely cultivated in gardens, known for continuous blooming throughout summer.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide (commonly North America and Europe)
plants.funFact: Knock Out roses are prized for their ability to bloom repeatedly and resist common rose diseases, making them popular for low-maintenance gardens.

plants.name: Nymphaea spp.
plants.description: Aquatic plants that produce beautiful floating flowers on ponds and lakes, opening during the day and closing at night.
plants.funFact: Water lilies regulate their temperature and can generate heat to attract pollinators, similar to some tropical plants.

plants.name: Tilia cordata
plants.description: A deciduous tree whose fragrant flowers attract many pollinators and are often used to make herbal tea.
plants.location: Europe and parts of western Asia
plants.funFact: Linden flowers are a favorite of bees, leading to production of high-quality linden honey cherished in Europe.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: A fast-growing ornamental tree native to Australia, producing striking orange flowers that attract birds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Winter to summer months (June to December) depending on region
plants.location: Australia, also cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite the name 'Silky Oak,' this plant is not an oak but a member of the Proteaceae family and produces nectar-rich flowers.
